Secrets of the Amber Temple
Wiz-DM BOT 31-07-2024 18:56
Through the misty air a crane flies. Winds push the bird to a fro but the paper crane is dedicated to its purpose. Finding its recipient. Out of a dark cloud filled sky the crane emerges dipping and diving as it is pattered with falling rain. It dives under the open gates of Vallaki. Weaving through the crowds waiting to register with the guards. It flies past Bethel's shop where foreigners gather to trade good. Over the houses and mansions of the city ever nearing its destination. It hovers patiently in front of the Blue water Inn, anticipating its chance to enter. As soon as a drunkard stumbles out it zooms through the cracked door, weaving over Danika serving drinks, past Rictavio playing a song, and finally into the lap of the mage Trellum, who this far has been enjoying his evening.
Trellum BOT 31-07-2024 19:26
Trellum moves pieces on his dragonchess board, after years of study, the complicated game is finally making sense. He look from the board to his book on the game, recreating a legendary game between two masters of the past. As he reads the next move, he takes a puff on his pipe, blowing out clouds in the shape of the defeated monsters from his last go at the arena. First a giant wurm, then a one-eyed aberration, and finally a witch that morphs to an angel. As his hands moves back to move the gryphon to make the crucial attack to end the game, his hand instead closes on a delicate paper bird, "Peculiar... Who are you?" He takes the bird and examines it. Wiz-DM BOT 05-08-2024 23:51
Trellum and Carnaxa take to the sky, flying above the herd. The caribou seem endless, their antlered heads bobbing up to stare as they pass. After fifteen to twenty minutes of flying. They come to the edge of the heard. Carnaxa spots three beasts that seem significant. The first is a gnarled old deer, aged white and grey fur overtaking the soft brown. Scars criscross the old deer's body, speaking of many battles. His left antler is sheered halfway from his skull, and underneath his left eye is covered in a sightless grey haze. Despite his age and injuries, Carnaxa can feel the weight of respect this deer carries. Lesser deer avoid his path and when he turns, the herd follows. The second caribou that catches Carnaxa's eye is a bulky female. Coming in at least a quarter heavier than any of the other females. This speaks to the this particular deer getting the choice grazing land. The third beast that catches her eye is a male in his prime. Solid muscles bulge under his hide. His pristine antlers are held high as he walks among his peers. His breath mists as he snorts at any other male that dare come to close, sending them bowing and backing away. Carnaxa believes any of these three may aid her, if she can convince them of her need.

A light rain falls falls as the party passes through the endless herd. Rain sater mixes with the snow and mud, slowing the passage of the hundreds of hooves walking through. Thunder roars in the distance as the weather slowly becomes worse. The sky flashing with the crack of lighting. Uncannily the sky grows dark and the temperature precipitously drops. The ill omen elicits nervous snorts from the caribou. Fur and hair stand on end as the air becomes thick with static. BOOOOOMMMM With a crack of thunder the clouds split. A massive bird swoops from the heavens 100 feet to the east of the party. Before any traveler or beast can react, the humongous bird has a deer in each claw and one in its beak. There is a shocked silence as the bird takes flight, returning to the heavens and behind cloud cover. BOOOOOOMMMMMM The second peal of thunder breaks the silence. Hell breaks loose as the herd panics, caribou turning every way. Like the braking of a damn, the caribou seem to align on a direction and begin to run west through the muddy earth. Panic does not negate their agreement with the travelers as the beasts seem conscious of them, the stream of beasts doing its best to flow around them. Still control and fear war within each caribou. Casimir grunts as he is shouldered to the ground by a frightened deer. A second beast nearly tramples Janlos, a quick dive saving him from falling under hoof. BOOOOOOMMMMMM Again the giant bird dives from the heavens. This time to the north. It snatches two deer before disappearing into the clouds. The flow herd veers south, away from the previous attack. It does little good as the bird is fast and hidden from sight. Where will it strike next?
